intro: [WRONG START] Metros cynia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. They typically have hairy stems and leaves that are often lance-shaped or ovate. Metrocynia species are often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
